handDesc.p: Halantas. Final N looks like na, but is slightly reduced in size and seems to have a horizontal line attached to the left of its head, e.g. l10 māsāN. Final M is a small circle at foot height, open at the top, with a tail that starts toward the right, then curves sharply up and then again turns right and down, extended all the way to baseline, e.g. l10 and l11 triṁśataM. Final M can also take the more common (or earlier?) form of a raised circle with a sinuous tail, e.g. l21 bhuvaM.
Original punctuation marks are straight verticals, with a very small knob at the top and bottom that is not always present, or at least not always visible in the estampage.

Other palaeographic observations. Anusvāra is at head height after the character to which it belongs, or occasionally at median height. Dependent o is normally in the cursive form. The tail of its marker sometimes descends below headline and is thus hard to distinguish from au, but the latter's humps seem to be asymmetrical.

projectDesc.p: This project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_IdListMembers_V01.xml file.

lg.l: deyāt śc chivaḥ svayaṁ śaṁ vaḥ

div.p:
svasti. śrīmatāṁ sakala-bhuvana-saṁstūyamāna-māna
vya-sagotrāṇāṁ hārīti-putrāṇāṁ kauśikī-vara-prasāda-labdha-rājyānām mātr̥-gaṇa-paripālitā
nāṁ svāmi-mahāsena-pādānudhyātānāṁ bhagavan-nārāyaṇa-prasāda-samāsādita-vara
-varāha-lāñchanekṣaṇa-kṣaṇa-vaśīkr̥tārāti-maṇḍalānām aśvamedhāvabhr̥tha-snāna-pa
vitrīkr̥ta-vapuṣāṁ cālukyānāṁ kulam alaṁkariṣṇos satyāśraya-vallabhendra
sya bhrātā kubja-viṣṇuvarddhana-nr̥patir aṣṭādaśa varṣāṇi| veṁgī-deśam apālayaT||
tad-ātmajo jayasiṁhas trayastrimśaTtaṁ|| tad-anujendrarāja-nandano viṣṇuvarddhano nava|| ta
t-sūnur mmaṁgi-yuvarājaḥ paṁcaviṁśatim|| tat-putro jayasiṁhas trayodaśa|| tad-ava
rajaḥ kokkiliṣ ṣaṇ māsāN|| tasya jyeṣṭho bhrātā viṣṇuvarddhanas tam uccāṭya saptatriṁśataM|| tat-pu
tro vijayāditya-bhaṭṭārako ’py aṣṭādaśa|| tat-suto viṣṇuvarddhanaṣ ṣaṭtriṁśataM||

lg.l: kr̥tvā prottuṁgam aṣṭottara-śatam abhunag vīra-dhīr aṣṭa-yuktāś

catvā
riṁśat samāḥ kṣmāṁ jana-nuta-vijayāditya-nāmā narendraḥ||

div.p:
tat-putraḥ kali-viṣṇuva
rddhano ’dhyarddha-varṣaṁ| tat-suto guṇagāṁka-vijayāditya-mahārājaś catuścatvā
riṁśataM| tad-anuja-yuvarāja-vikramāditya-narapātmajaḥ cālukya-bhīma-bhūpas triṁśataM

tat-sūnur ammarājas sapta varṣāni| tat-pitāmaho a- guṇagāṁka-vijayādityānuja-yu
ddhamallātmajaḥ tālādhipo māsam ekaM| taṁ yudhi vinihatya cālukya-bhīmātmajo vikramā
dityaḥ Ari-nikara-timira-dinakaraḥ dvija-dīnānātha-bandhur ekādaśa māsāN|

lg.l:
bhīmo bhīma-parākramas samabhunak saṁva
tsarān dvādaśa||

loka
mahādevyāḥ khalu yas samabhavad ammarājākhyaḥ
dhanuṣi ravau ghaṭa-lagne dvādaśa-varṣe tu janmanaḥ paṭṭaṁ|
satata-payo-dhenur abhīr nnirītir aparug nirasta-coro deśaḥ|

yasmin vrajati kṣiti
pe bahirudyānāvalokanārtthaṁ bhītāḥ|

yo rūpeṇa manojaṁ vibhavena mahendram ahimakaram uru-mahasā
||

div.p:
@@@sa sakala-ripu-nr̥pati-makuṭa-taṭa-ghaṭita-maṇi-kiraṇa-gaṇa-madhukara-nikara-paricuṁbita-caraṇa-sarasi-ruha-yugalo ’yuga-locana-pada-kamala-vilasan-madhu-pāyamāno mānonnato natoddhatas samasta-bhuvanāśraya-śrī-vijayāditya-mahārājādhirāja-parameśvaraḥ parama-bhaṭṭārakaḥ parama-māheśvaraḥ[+||]
Face IIIb. guḍla-kaṇḍervvāḍi-viṣaya-nivāsino rāṣṭrakūṭa-pramukhān kuṭuṁbinaḥ samāhūyettham ājñāpayati[+||] viditam astu vaḥ[+||] vijayāvāṭyāṁ cālukya-kula-tilaka-samasta-bhuvanāśraya-vijayāditya-narendra-mr̥garāja-pratiṣṭāpitāya samasta-bhuvanāśraya-nāma devālaya-nivāsāya umā-maheśvarāya uttarāyaṇa-nimitta asmad deśa-santatyāyurārogaiśvaryyābhivr̥ddhyartthaṁ tad-devālaya-khaṇḍa-sphuṭita-nava-karmma-bali-nivedyātodya-satra-pravarttanārtthaṁ ca alpavr̥ttitayā ālūna-viśīrṇṇaṁ punar ṇavīkarttuṁ sarvva-kara-parihārena deva-[bho*]gī[kr̥*]tyodaka-pūrvvaṁ tāṇḍikoṇḍa-nāma-grāmaḥ ammalapūṇḍi-gollapūṇḍi-āsuvulapaṟṟu-nāmādisabheto ’smābhir ddatta iti[+||] asya sa-grāmāṭikasy2463āvadāyaḥ[+||] pūrvvataḥ tūṇḍeru[+||] āgneyataḥ gārala-guṇṭa[+||] dakṣiṇata[ḥ*] lāmuna yuttaraṁbuna būrugu[+||]
Face IVa. nairr̥tataḥ2464 oḍḍa-guṇṭa[+||] paścimataḥ catiya-nāma-taṭakam[+||] vāyavyataḥ bhīma-samudra-nāma-taṭakam2465[+||] uttarataḥ enuka-ṟālu[+||] īśānataḥ2466 regadu-guṇṭa[+||] yuge yuge svīkr̥ta-rudra-mūrttayo munīśvarāḥ śrī-lakulīśvarādayaḥ[+|] babhūvur atrānugr̥hīta saj-janāḥ svayaṁ bhuvo dharmma-patha-pradarśinaḥ[+||] (15) tad-anvaye kālamukhāś śrutī-mukhyās svayaṁ bhuvo bhuvi bhu-bhr̥tāṁ abhivandyāḥ tat-siṁhaparṣad aste sthānasyāsyādhipataya iha hita-caritāḥ[+||] teṣām amaravaṭeśvarādyaneka-purāṇa-devāyatana-nivāsināṁ kālamukhānāṁ santatau[+||] lakaśipur-nnikhilāgama-pāradr̥k paśupatir-mmunipo ’pi patiś śr̥iyaḥ[+|] sujala-śaka-payaḥ phala-mūlakair vvihita-dharmma-śarīra-vivarddhanaḥ[+||] (16) yas tan muneś śiṣya[ḥ*] prabhūtarāśir nnāma paṇḍitas sākṣad dharmmāvatāraḥ[+|] tac-chiṣyau vidyeśvara-vameśvarau[+||] tat-prabhūtarāśi-bhrātr̥-bhuvanarāśi-muneś śiṣyau paśupati[h*]̣ prabhūtarāśi ca[+|] kalamukhendrādyapara-nāmā[+|] tac-chiṣyaḥ paśupatiḥ parahita-vyasanī[+|]
Face IVb. tac-chiṣyah yas ca vidvān vidyeśvaro nāma karttum anvartthakan nijam[+|] sarvva-vidyās samādhatte yathāṁ būni-mahāṁ budhiḥ[+||] (17) tat-kīrtti-lakṣmyor yyuvarāja eko ’py aneka-lokopakr̥tāvanekaḥ[+|] na nāmataḥ kevalam artthaś ca prabhūtarāśiḥ prabhur āśritānām[+||] (18) sa svakiya guru-sannidhau śilāmayaṁ devakulaṁ (m)maṭhaṁ2467 ca tribhūmikaṁ kr̥tvā[+|] grāma-trayaṁ kṣetram ajā-sahasraṁ prabhūtarāśir llabhate sma bhūpāt[+||] (19) asyoparī na kenacid bādhā karttavyā yaḥ karoti sa paṁca-mahāpātakair llipyate[+|] uktaṁ ca[+||] sva-dattāṁ para-dattāṁ vā yo haretā vasundharām[+|] ṣaṣṭi-varṣa-sahasrāṇi viṣṭāyāṁ jāyate kr̥miḥ[+||] (20) bahubhir vvasudhā dattā bahubhiś cānupālitā[+|] yasya yasya yadā bhūmis tasya tasya tadā phalam[+||] (21) śāsanasya śri[ye*] cāsya dātā syād amma-bhūmipaḥ[+|] vidyeśvaraḥ guruḥ karttājñaptiḥ kaṭakanāyakaḥ[+||] (22) * * * * * * 2468

app.note: @@@CHECK No facsimile of the first page is published. Although KRR do not add a note stating that their oṁ is expressed by a symbol, it seems much more likely to me that the text began with an auspicious symbol rather than the word oṁ.
The small circle above mā is not positioned like a regular anusvāra, and I take it to be part of a subsequently added visarga, in conjunction with a smaller dot near baseline height.
KRR print a clear punctuation mark here, but I do not see one and do not think one may have fit here before the plate's raised border.

div.p: First reported in 9A/1914-19151with a description at 90-9111. Edited from estampages by B. V. Krishna Rao and B. L. Rajahmundry (), with estampages but no translation. The present edition by Dániel Balogh is based on a collation of KRR's edition with the published images.As there is no estampage of 1v, my edition follows Krishna Rao and Rajahmundry precisely for that page unless otherwise noted, and the position of the binding hole is not indicated there.
